greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest 4th power dividing n.
comment: Multiplicative with a(p^e) = p^(4[e/4]). - _Mitch Harris_, Apr 19 2005
link: Michael De Vlieger, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Dirichlet g.f.: zeta(s) * zeta(4s-4) / zeta(4s). - _Álvar Ibeas_, Feb 12 2015
Sum_{k=1..n} a(k) ~ Zeta(5/4) * n^(5/4) / (5*Zeta(5)) - 45*n/Pi^4. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 03 2019
mathematica: Max@ Select[Divisors@ #, IntegerQ@ Power[#, 1/4] &] & /@ Range@ 81 (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 18 2015 *)
program: (PARI) a(n) = {f = factor(n); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,2] = 4*(f[i,2]\4);); factorback(f);} \\ _Michel Marcus_, Mar 16 2015
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
ext: Entry improved by comments from _Henry Bottomley_, Feb 29 2000
